file_content.text: Hurry and leave before the place caves in.
You are more... powerful than I could... have... imagined....
This fighting is foolish, Sith.
The chamber nears collapse. Persist and you will perish, while I will simply return to my trance and commune once more with the Force.
Walk away now with your mission complete--and I will live out my life buried here, at one with the Force.
I sense panic in you. You know I will defeat you in time.
You're weakening. [Attack.]
Then I will have to summon all my strength.
Commune with the Force under rubble, then.
Fine. Go bury yourself.
Cease your senseless chatter, old man!
No! To the death! [Attack.]
I warned you. Now your fate is sealed.
Stop, Sith. Had my strength returned before this moment, I would have kept Xerender from engaging you.
Now, he is down, and your fight has made this chamber unstable. It is nearing an inevitable collapse.
You've proven your superiority. Let me bargain for Xerender's life.
My master was very clear--you and Xerender must not survive.
My orders are to kill.
Death is not the only solution. Baras seeks our removal, and I have no desire to return to fight for the Republic.
Hurry.
This fight was unnecessary. I have no intention of returning to fight for the Republic.
Xerender is young and driven yet he has only begun to grasp the ways of the Force.
In truth, I was the same until being buried on Hoth. Here, I communed with the Force to the exclusion of all else.
His life is forfeit.
No. [Kill Xerender.]
Goodbye, my old friend. Now I wish I had not summoned you here.
Sith, your efforts to neutralize us are unnecessary. I have no interest in continuing the fight against the Empire.
Buried here all this time, I have communed with the Force to the exclusion of all else.
You must be more powerful than ever.
Then I have my hands full.
You have my attention.
It has been a great privilege and quite mind-expanding.
Why should I care?
I should mean nothing to you as well, then.
The Force is with me, greater than ever now. I suspect that I could defeat you quite handily.
But I am no longer concerned with the tidings of this galaxy, or these times. I only seek to continue my transcendence.
If that's true, why did you summon Xerender here?
But you called for help?
I wanted to share my revelations and bring him to the same understanding.
Why should I trust you?
Only a coward lies. The Force has elevated me above such frailties. I have no fear of you.
This excavation site is nearing collapse. Should we battle, we would both be crushed.
Leave me here to be buried again. You will complete your mission, and I shall enjoy a life at one with the Force.
Allow Xerender and me to be buried here for eternity. Your objective will be met, and our lives will be richer, finding oneness with the Force.
I can't let you become even stronger.
It's too risky.
Then you leave me no choice but to fight you. Know this--my journey will continue.
Either I vanquish you quickly and leave this planet to commune with the Force, or we duel until the inevitable collapse of this chamber.
I like the sound of that.
Agreed, Bury yourselves.
Then save yourself and leave this place before the ceiling crashes down.
I will quiet my mind and prepare myself.
I will protect Xerender and prepare myself for the collapse.
You have my gratitude, Sith. A precise lightsaber sweep as you exit will cause the cave-in.
How about death instead?
Never. [Attack.]
I can't allow you to get stronger.
Transcend to death. [Attack.]
I shall either vanquish you quickly or fend you off until this cavern collapses on us both.
Fresh air in my lungs. Light on my face....
I told you, Sith. Now you are crushed, and I shall continue my transcendence.
